item.title: Data Engineering is Cool Too
item.description: In our separate day jobs, my colleague and I usually spend our time working on the business-facing side of data science. This project was an effort to broaden our understanding of the entire data process and deepen our knowledge within the behind-the-scenes work of data engineering. To do this, we decided to simulate the transaction, customer, and product data of a fake business, which we called JJ Furnitiure (JJ stands for Jon and Julian). Check out what we learned…

item.title: Web Scraping The Big Rock: A Famous Fishing Tournament
item.description: Michael Jordan enters this tournament - there’s $6M in overall prize money - it’s a big deal! I have been web scraping the data from this tournament’s website for the past 5 years and in this post I will demonstrate how I do that using Python. Afterwards, I dig into the data and make some plots using R. Let’s get fishy üêü
